title: Oberkorn
text:
Oberkorn (, <a href="French%20language">fr</a>: Obercorn <a href="German%20language">de</a>: Oberkorn ) is a town in the <a href="Communes%20of%20Luxembourg">commune</a> of <a href="Differdange">Differdange</a> in south-western <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a>. , the town had a <a href="population">population</a> of 4,584.
Etymology.
Both the towns of Oberkorn and <a href="Niederkorn">Niederkorn</a> get their names from the river D'Kuer (also called as Kar, Kor or Korn) in <a href="Luxembourgish">Luxembourgish</a> or the <a href="Chiers">Chiers</a> in <a href="English%20language">English</a> and <a href="French%20language">French</a> or Korn in <a href="German%20language">German</a>. The river Chiers is a right tributary of the <a href="Meuse">Meuse</a>. The source of the Chiers is near <a href="https%3A//goo.gl/maps/Eaz9UTnXrVn8Nym86">Oberkorn</a>. The Chiers flows roughly in western direction, and crosses the border with Belgium and flows through <a href="Athus">Athus</a> (<a href="Luxembourg%20%28Belgium%29">province of Luxembourg</a>). 
Administration.
The administration of this town falls under the commune of Differdange together with other towns <a href="Niederkorn">Niederkorn</a>, <a href="Lasauvage">Lasauvage</a>, Differdange-Fousbann.
Education.
Oberkorn has couple of primary schools Ecole Prince Henri and <a href="https%3A//goo.gl/maps/sWiJw8wCd8UUoGA46">Um bok</a>.
<a href="https%3A//www.lunex-university.net/university/about-lunex-university/">Lunex University</a>, located in Oberkorn offers graduate and specialist programs in physiotherapy, sport and exercise science, and sport management.
Sports.
<a href="FC%20Differdange%2003">FC Differdange 03</a>'s <a href="https%3A//goo.gl/maps/VUDT41L9BrjKkxLG8">home stadium</a> is located in Oberkorn. That apart the two football clubs and also play in that locality. 
Oberkorn also has an outdoor and indoor swimming pool with training and coaching facilities at <a href="https%3A//www.vert-marine.info/aquasud/">Aquasud</a>.
Sports centre Parc des Sports is Differdange commune's sport complex offering martial arts, boxing and handball. 
There is also an athletic field <a href="https%3A//goo.gl/maps/m98pC6BFik6Yvwgo8">Stade Jaminet</a> in this town.
Places of interest.
Hall O is a dedicated indoor location to organise festivities, markets or fairs.
Espace H2O a sustainable multipurpose cultural space for art exhibitions. An old water reservoir in Oberkorn was renovated on the centennial of city of Differdange. 
The Church of Oberkorn (Luxembourgish: ) is a Catholic church belonging to the Parish of Saint-François-Assise. The patron is Saint Stephen (St. Etienne), whose feast is celebrated on December 26. 
The church was consecrated on July 1, 1912, by <a href="Johannes%20Joseph%20Koppes">Bishop Jean-Joseph Koppes</a>.
Getting around.
The town of Oberkorn is served by dedicated <a href="Oberkorn%20railway%20station">train station</a> connecting to Luxembourg city.
The commune of Differdange provides <a href="https%3A//differdange.lu/en/differdange-and-you/getting-around/diffbus/">DiffBus</a> - electric buses that go around the commune of Differdange.
There are also <a href="https%3A//differdange.lu/en/differdange-and-you/getting-around/bus-rgtr/">longer route bus services</a> connecting to other communes and city of <a href="Luxembourg%20City">Luxembourg</a>. 
One can get around the town of Oberkorn and the commune of Differdange on bicycles as well.
Popular Media.
The new wave band <a href="Depeche%20Mode">Depeche Mode</a> released a song called "<a href="https%3A//www.youtube.com/watch%3Fv%3Dkm_51ctr6Ow">Oberkorn (It's a Small Town)</a>", which refers to the town, as a <a href="A-side%20and%20B-side">B-side</a> on their 1982 single "<a href="The%20Meaning%20of%20Love">The Meaning of Love</a>". 
In addition, <a href="Depeche%20Mode">Depeche Mode</a> also used "Oberkorn (It's a Small Town)" as a prelude to "<a href="My%20Secret%20Garden%20%28Depeche%20Mode%20song%29">My Secret Garden</a>" from the album "<a href="A%20Broken%20Frame">A Broken Frame</a>" when recorded live at the Hammersmith Odeon, now named <a href="HMV%20Hammersmith%20Apollo">HMV Hammersmith Apollo</a>.
<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a> techno group <a href="OBK">OBK</a>, from the song by Depeche Mode, also makes an indirect reference to the town.
A song by the band "Petrograd" (Luxembourgish <a href="Punk%20rock">punk band</a>) "is" called "Uewerkuer." 
<a href="https%3A//www.analoguesolutions.com/oberkorn-step-sequencer">Oberkorn</a> is also the name of a British-made model of <a href="Analog%20sequencer">analogue step sequencers</a> made by <a href="https%3A//www.analoguesolutions.com/">Analogue Solutions</a>.
